node.text:
"Because of climate change we are seeing even more intense storms, rising sea levels and many deaths. But we don’t have to accept this – we can act - and we must act as a matter of justice."

Environmentalist Sunita Narain explains why it's important that all of us #ActNow to achieve the goals of the #ParisAgreement. 

"Every country, rich or poor, is exposed to extreme weather. We need to build better and more resilient infrastructure – from electricity grids to roads, bridges and buildings. All these approaches are set out in the Paris Climate Agreement – adopted by nearly 200 countries. We can do it – we must do it – and we must act quickly."

From recycling to using less energy and water to opting for public transport, each and every one of us can take little steps in our everyday lives that can have a big impact. Tell us in the comments what you are doing to protect our planet.

#ClimateAction #GlobalGoals

node.text:
"We don’t have to choose between using energy and protecting the planet."

@unep Young Champion of the Earth Nzambi Matee explains the role sustainable energy plays in building a better future for all. 
 
"Imagine a world where every job is based on clean, renewable energy – and where wind and solar are even more abundant. And where energy is affordable and reliable – and available to everyone. This might sound like a fantasy – but it’s achievable and we know how to get there."

The #ParisAgreement on the climate emergency is our roadmap for moving to a low-carbon economy and achieving a sustainable future. Since this international #ClimateAction treaty opened for signature 5 years ago, almost 200 countries have signed on to tackle the climate crisis together to limit global warming to protect people and planet.

 #GlobalGoals #ActNow

node.text:
Cities are major contributors to the climate crisis, but also an important hub for #ClimateAction.

@UNEP Young Champion of the Earth Nzambi Matee explains what a green future for cities could look like & how the #ParisAgreement can help us get there.

node.text: Meet @unep Young Champion of the Earth Nzambi Matee. She's a Kenyan engineer taking #ClimateAction and helping to #BeatPlasticPollution by recycling plastic waste into building materials.

node.text:
"My warmest wishes to everyone celebrating #EidAlFitr," #UnitedNations Secretary-General @antonioguterres said on Wednesday.

"I was delighted to mark the end of Ramadan with Asia El-Sayeed Ali, a Yemeni health worker helping malnourished children and mothers in a @worldfoodprogramme-supported nutrition clinic.

Asia personifies core values of Ramadan: compassion and empathy. Her resilience in the face of the devastating conflict in Yemen, as well as her life-saving work in support of people in desperate need have moved me greatly.

As #Ramadan comes to an end, let us continue drawing inspiration from its many lessons of solidarity that are celebrated during this Holy Month."

Regram: @antonioguterres

node.text:
Regram: @antonioguterres

Young people are the most affected by the climate decisions taken today. Their ideas, voices and actions are crucial to deliver meaningful and ambitious #ClimateAction for all.

@pcopaloma and @mahery_loha are two inspiring climate activists who exemplify the leadership and commitment of young people worldwide to address the most challenging problems we face today.

I'm grateful for our discussion and their insights on how to achieve the meaningful participation of youth, women and indigenous peoples as we tackle the climate crisis.

#ActNow #GlobalGoals

node.text:
@unep Goodwill Ambassador @aidanrgallagher describes how the #ParisAgreement can help us create a world free from the threats of the climate crisis. 

"This is personal for me," he explains. "I don’t want to choke on the air I breathe, or see wildfires burning out of control. So let’s keep working together. And you too can protect what is left and repair what has been damaged."

On Thursday's #EarthDay, @antonioguterres will be joining the U.S. Leaders’ Summit on Climate to reiterate his call for urgent #ClimateAction. 

"The Paris Agreement is our pact with our children, grandchildren & the whole human family," said the Secretary-General. 

"The climate crisis is the race of our lifetimes. We must go much further, and much faster."

#GenerationRestoration #ForNature

node.text: On Monday's International Day of Human Space Flight, @europeanspaceagency astronaut @thom_astro became the newest @fao Goodwill Ambassador. He will use his voice and unique perspective from space to advocate for #ClimateAction and to help reduce hunger.

node.title: French astronaut Thomas Pesquet becomes newest @fao Goodwill Ambassador

node.text:
All children have the right to a happy and healthy childhood, free from discrimination and full of love and acceptance. And acceptance begins at home. Every child should grow up in safe, loving and nurturing environment.

No child should suffer because of who they are. All children deserve protection and equal rights. Let's see kids the way they see themselves.

On Wednesday's International Transgender Day of Visibility, join @unaidsglobal in calling for the rights of transgender children to be protected.

#TransDayOfVisibility #SeeMeAsIAm

node.text:
Six years since the start of the conflict, millions of Yemenis are in need of humanitarian assistance. Over four million are displaced within the country. 

Our colleagues from UNHCR, the #UnitedNations Refugees Agency, are in #Yemen providing aid, but they cannot do it alone. 

Please click the link in the @refugees' bio to help. 

#YemenCantWait

node.text:
Maya (@ghazalmia) fled Damascus, #Syria at age 16 and overcame numerous barriers to become the world’s first female Syrian refugee pilot. 

Check out her inspiring story!

#WithRefugees

node.title: Meet Maya Ghazal, the newest @refugees Goodwill Ambassador

node.text:
We remember all those we have loved and lost to this deadly disease. 

#covid

node.title: More than 2 million people have died from #COVID19

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by United Nations on July 28, 2021. May be an image of 4 people and people standing.

node.text:
For 70 years, the Refugee Convention has been protecting people forced to flee.

The 1951  Convention laid the groundwork for refugee rights, as well as the legal obligations of states to protect every person forced to flee.

People become refugees not by choice but forced by circumstance. With war, conflict and persecution having displaced 82 million people globally, recommitting to the Convention's spirit and fundamental principles is as urgent as ever. 

As the guardian of the Refugee Convention, the #UnitedNations Refugee Agency (UNHCR) continues to work around the world to save lives, protect rights and build a better future for all refugees, displaced communities and stateless people.

Regram: @refugees I 📸: UNHCR / Celine Schmitt, Eugene Sibomana, Szabo

#WithRefugees

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by United Nations on July 28, 2021. May be an image of 4 people and people standing.
Photo by United Nations on July 28, 2021. May be an image of 1 person and child.
Photo by United Nations on July 28, 2021. May be an image of 2 people, people standing and outdoors.
Photo by United Nations on July 28, 2021. May be an image of 3 people and indoor.
Photo by United Nations on July 27, 2021. May be an image of text.

node.text:
During times of high-stress, it is completely normal to feel anxious, isolated or overwhelmed. It's important to look after your #MentalHealth:

🏃🏽‍♀️🥗 Stay active and eat well.
📲 Stay in contact with friends and family. 
🤗 Be kind to yourself & others.

🎨: @unwomen

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by United Nations on July 27, 2021. May be an image of 2 people, people standing, outdoors and text that says 'MP M'.

node.text:
#Guatemala provides military & police officers to seven @unpeacekeeping missions around the world.

#UnitedNations peacekeepers leave their families behind to keep the peace, restore stability, protect civilians and help create conditions under which refugees can voluntarily return home.

They are #ServingForPeace at great personal risk and under harsh conditions to help others, including amid the challenging conditions caused by the #COVID19 pandemic.

👉 Scroll through to see pictures of peacekeepers from Guatemala working for the @unpeacekeeping mission in the Democratic Republic of the Congo (MONUSCO) and the former UN mission in Haiti (MINUSTAH).

📸: @monusco_officiel, MINUSTAH/Logan Abassi & Marco Domino

#A4P #GlobalGoals

Photo by United Nations on July 27, 2021. May be an image of 3 people, child, people sitting and outdoors.

node.text:
Mother Poppy and her daugther share a cheerful moment together in Cox's Bazar refugee camp, in #Bangladesh.

The young mother has been the breadwinner for her family for almost three years and serves as an inspiration for her little daughter. Thanks to the support from the World Food Programme (WFP), Poppy has received adequate financial training and the tools to start her own successful business. She now sells her surplus produce at the WFP-supported farmer's market to help feed her family.

WFP is working to support the Rohingya community including by providing access to a variety of fresh food through local markets, delivering economic opportunities and providing financial support.

Regram: @worldfoodprogramme | 📸: WFP / Sayed Asif Mahmud

#ZeroHunger #GlobalGoals

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by United Nations on July 26, 2021. May be an image of nature, body of water and tree.

node.text:
Monday is World #MangroveDay!

Mangroves are rare ecosystems found on the boundaries between land and sea. They can help promote #ClimateAction by strengthening our natural coastal defense by protecting us from storms, tsunamis and sea level rise, and serving as nurseries for fish and crustaceans.

All of us can help protect mangroves by understanding what is driving their loss, making sustainable choices, and more.

The #UnitedNations Environment Programme (UNEP) works around the world to help inspire, inform and enable countries and people to protect the environment and preserve the planet for future generations.

Regram: @unep I 📸 matt_curnock /Ocean Image Bank/ @theoceanagency

#GlobalGoals

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by United Nations on July 25, 2021.

node.text:
We are celebrating #Tokyo2020 with a new set of commemorative stamps highlighting how sport can help build a more peaceful world. 

The collection reflects the values of respect, mutual understanding and goodwill shared by the @olympics  and the #UnitedNations.

See link in @unstamps bio to get yours!

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by United Nations on July 25, 2021. May be an illustration of 2 people and text.

node.text:
Misinformation is costing lives and prolonging the #COVID19 pandemic. 

But all of us can do something about it: Before you share something online, #PledgeToPause and take time to verify facts about the post:
WHO made the post?
WHAT is the source?
WHERE did it come from?
WHY are you sharing it?
WHEN was it published?

Help stop the spread of misinformation -- and the virus.

🎨: @ruthburrowsillustration

node.text:
The @tokyo2020  Olympics will have close to equal representation of women & men athletes for the first time in the history of the games.

For comparison, only 22 women (2.2%) out of 997 athletes competed in the modern @olympics  for the first time in 1900.

#WomenInSport defy gender stereotypes, make inspiring role models & demonstrate equality. 

#GenerationEquality #Tokyo2020 

Regram: @unwomen

node.text:
"Because of climate change we are seeing even more intense storms, rising sea levels and many deaths. But we don’t have to accept this – we can act - and we must act as a matter of justice."

Environmentalist Sunita Narain explains why it's important that all of us #ActNow to achieve the goals of the #ParisAgreement. 

"Every country, rich or poor, is exposed to extreme weather. We need to build better and more resilient infrastructure – from electricity grids to roads, bridges and buildings. All these approaches are set out in the Paris Climate Agreement – adopted by nearly 200 countries. We can do it – we must do it – and we must act quickly."

From recycling to using less energy and water to opting for public transport, each and every one of us can take little steps in our everyday lives that can have a big impact. Tell us in the comments what you are doing to protect our planet.

#ClimateAction #GlobalGoals

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by United Nations in Tokyo Japan. May be an image of one or more people, people standing and text that says 'Refugee Team Olympic'.

node.text:
The #RefugeesOlympic team enters the stadium during the #Tokyo2020 opening ceremony on Friday. 

These 29 athletes from 11 countries will compete in swimming, wrestling and athletics, among other sports at this year‘s Olympic Games. Their participation is bringing global attention to the magnitude of the refugee crisis.

"We believe – and we know you believe - in the power of sport to change lives. To heal, to bring hope," @refugees  chief @filippograndi told the athletes. "We stand beside you. Be aware that we are all cheering loudly, from all corners of the world."

Regram: @refugees | 📸: IOC / @refugeeolympicteam

#GlobalGoals #WithRefugees #CheerForRefugees

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by United Nations on July 23, 2021. May be an image of fire and indoor.

node.text:
The Olympic Cauldron has been lit. 

"The Olympic spirit brings out humanity’s best:
Teamwork. 
Talent.
Tolerance. 
Solidarity,”

said UN Secretary-General @antonioguterres. 

"Every athlete in the #Tokyo2020 Olympics has overcome enormous obstacles and demonstrated great determination. If we bring that same energy to our global challenges, we can achieve anything. Peace. A green, thriving planet. A more equal world — rooted in supporting the most vulnerable and leaving no one behind.

Let us race together to that future. The #UnitedNations and I are honoured to be your teammate every step of the way."

Regram: @olympics 

#GlobalGoals #ClimateAction #StandUp4HumanRights

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by United Nations on July 22, 2021. May be an image of 9 people, people standing and indoor.

node.text:
Meet the Refugee Olympic Team competing in #Tokyo2020! 

These 29 athletes from 11 countries will compete in swimming, wrestling and athletics, among other sports at this year‘s Olympic Games. Their participation is bringing global attention to the magnitude of the refugee crisis. 

When they were forced to flee, they gave up everything, except for their dreams. Competing as one team, these athletes give hope to millions of refugees around the world and inspire us all.

With more than 80 million people displaced worldwide, the #UnitedNations Refugee Agency is working to provide every person forced to flee with access to basic necessities, including food, shelter, education, and much more.

Regram: @refugees| 📸: IOC Media

#CheerForRefugees
